qas.question: Upon what is Portuguese agriculture based?

answers.text: small to medium-sized family-owned dispersed units

qas.question: What types of companies back more large scale, export-oriented agrobusinesses in Portugal?

answers.text: Grupo RAR's Vitacress, Sovena, Lactogal, Vale da Rosa, Companhia das Lezírias and Valouro

qas.question: What types of crops does Portugal produce?

answers.text: tomatoes, citrus, green vegetables, rice, corn, barley, olives, oilseeds, nuts, cherries, bilberry, table grapes, edible mushrooms

qas.question: What types of livestock products does Portugal produce?

context: Agriculture in Portugal is based on <a0_0>small to medium-sized family-owned dispersed units<a0_0/>. However, the sector also includes larger scale intensive farming export-oriented agrobusinesses backed by companies (like <a1_0>Grupo RAR's Vitacress, Sovena, Lactogal, Vale da Rosa, Companhia das Lezírias and Valouro<a1_0/>). The country produces a wide variety of crops and livestock products, including <a2_0>tomatoes, citrus, green vegetables, rice, corn, barley, olives, oilseeds, nuts, cherries, bilberry, table grapes, edible mushrooms<a2_0/>, <a3_0>dairy products, poultry and beef<a3_0/>.
